who: IDEO.org
ideo.org is out to design an end to pove: through the products, services, and experiences that we design; through the problem solvers we fuel; and by inspiring the social sector to adopt human-centered design. IDEO.org is working with the Rockefeller Foundation for nine month period to develop a strategy to enhance the innovation capabilities of its grantees. Together we want to explore new ways of highlighting, amplifying, and supporting innovation at the organizations that the Rockefeller Foundation supports. We’ll conduct design research with a set of organizations in the U.S. and sub-Saharan Africa, run some prototypes and pilots, and develop a comprehensive strategy with the foundation. IDEO.org is looking for an Organizational Designer to join our Launchpad team. You might have a background in service design, organizational transformation, or change management. In any case, you’re someone with experience in human-centered design and strong project management skills. And we’re hoping you will join our team in New York for a 9 month engagement (March 15 - December 2016).

<em style=\"font-size: 11px; line-height:1.6">Radiolab is hiring a producer for its first ever spin-off podcast. The show is about the Supreme Court. It is also about all of the things that divide us as a nation – race, class, gender, sex, money, power, religion, and so on. We launch in late spring of 2016. The SCOTUS podcast (working title) seeks to explain how cases that are deliberated inside the rarefied world of the Supreme Court affect our lives outside of the court. The producer will be responsible for researching, identifying, and reporting stories about the Supreme Court and its cases, past and present. It will be your job to understand the complex machinations of the court and explain them in a compelling, narrative-driven, way to our listeners.

<span style=\"font-size: 11px">The Vera List Center for Art and Politics (VLC) at The New School seeks a full-time Curatorial Assistant to work 35 hours a week, Monday through Thursday, some hours during evenings and occasionally on weekends. The Vera List Center is one of the pre-eminent public research organizations on the intersection of artistic and political practices, and develops its program both independently and, at times, in close partnership with various programs at The New School. Working closely with the director/curator, the manager of programs and administration, students and interns, the curatorial assistant will be involved in all aspects of curating, organizing, and promoting the Vera List Center's programs. This entails research, developing curatorial frameworks and organizing public programs, publications, and occasional exhibitions related to the center's two main initiatives, the biennial curatorial focus theme and the biennial Vera List Center Prize for Art and Politics. In particular, the curatorial assistant will be charged with enhancing the impact of the live programs through the center's website and on-line resource guides.
